text:
GETTY Kate Middleton: The Duchess wore pearl earrings and Monsoon wedges to complete the outfit

Kate Middleton, 35, showcased a favourite closet staple on Saturday while she attended a tea part to honour 850 children of men and women who had died serving in the British military. The Duchess glowed in a £320 See by Chloe dress at the occasion, which took place on the grounds of Buckingham Palace. The dress featured a ruffle collar and long sleeves, and she accessorised the outfit with delicate pearl drop earrings. Kate previously wore the outfit last September during a party for Prince George and Princess Charlotte.

GETTY Kate Middleton: The Duchess wore a lace Chloe dress to the occaison

She wore the same earrings and Monsoon wedges as the time before, but her hair was styled differently. Back in September, she swept her glossy locks into a half-updo, but yesterday she wore her hair down and straight, but full of volume. The Duchess and her husband Prince William, appeared at Saturday’s event without their children, but with William’s brother Prince Harry. The three were seen chatting and playing with kids and taking photos with them on the lawn.

GETTY Kate Middleton: The party was in honour of British military families

GETTY Kate Middleton: The Duchess and Prince William attended the event with Prince Harry

The party included various activities, including cupcake-decorating, plate-spinning, face-painting and water balloon battles. The Royal Foundation’s Full Effect and Coach Core programmes also led workshops in beatboxing, breakdancing and sports. The party at the palace aimed to unite children with other families that have shared similar experiences. She was photographed wearing her favourite colour earlier this week, ahead of her sister Pippa Middleton’s wedding.

GETTY Kate Middleton: The Duchess was last ed in the dress last September
